qas.question: What was the BeiDou-2 system previously known as?

context: <b6_0>BeiDou-2<b6_0/> (formerly known as <a0_0><b5_0>COMPASS<b5_0/><a0_0/>) is not an extension to the older BeiDou-1, but rather supersedes it outright. <b7_0>The new system<b7_0/> will be a constellation of <a1_0>3<a2_0>5<a2_0/><a1_0/> satellites, which include 5 geostationary orbit satellites <a4_0>for backward compatibility with BeiDou-1<a4_0/>, and <a3_0><b8_0>30<b8_0/><a3_0/> non-geostationary satellites (27 in medium Earth orbit and 3 in inclined geosynchronous orbit), that will offer complete coverage of the globe.
